userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Carter Newman Bealer Papers, WLU Coll. 0094, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bealer was a student at Washington and Lee University from 1918-1922.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes family and business correspondence and a variety of private collections, such as diaries, playbills, ship menus, as well as a significant collection of autographed photographs and letters of late 19th and early 20th century theatrical and musical performers.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Theatre People- most autographed
Check payable to Edward Everett signed Andrew Stevenson for $50
Stock certificate showing Leonard C. William is entitled to 4 shares of capital stock of the Mystic National Bank in Connecticut
Signature of "Alben W. Barkley" (torn off of a check)
Receipt for Mr D. Scorie for Joseph Bradley Furniture
Two checks written by E. Clemens, one to Senator Max Barnboker for $1 (1955) and another to Rockwell Kent for 50 cents (1954).
Deposit slip for $550 for John Mopeley to the credit of George Hinmria from the New Haven County Bank
1896 Georgia State Tax Card and related items Signed Mrs. E. J. W. Bealer
Various Work Orders for Business/Construction in Georgia
Papers regarding a dispute of title from the Law Offices of Daley, Chambers, and Smith
Papers regarding the Southern Baptist Convention of Asheville, NC
San Diego, California Real Estate License for P.M. Bealer
Estate Papers for P.M. Bealer, executed by Carter Newman Bealer
Series of Photographs of Harry Leroy Gray
Collection of letters between Gray and his mother
Ship Menus - French Line, S.S. France
Ship Menus - French Line, S.S. Libert√©
Ship Menus - French Line, S.S. Ile De France
Newspaper Clipping of Joe Di Maggie in Baltimore, MD
Newspaper Clippings of Various Plays, Actors, and Playwrights in Chicago
New York Times Book Review on WIlliam Goldhunt's Biography of F. Scott Fitzgerald, "F. Scott Fitzgerald and His Contemporaries"
The New York Times Newspaper Photograph of Manhattan's Church of Transfiguration
The New York Times Book Review on Richard Church's 1956 Autobiography- "Suddenly I Was Armed with a Weapon: A Distinguished Author Relives His Boyhood and His Discovery that Poetry Was a Sword"
Philadelphia Inquirer Spread - Women's Clothing modeled by Hollywood Movie Stars on one side and drawings of the freak Pacific Weather on the reverse
Chicago Sun Newspaper Clipping on the fighter plane crash that killed Collin Kelly written by W.L. White
Chicago Tribune Newspaper Clipping - "Ten Years Ago This Week She Killed Two Friends" Article on Winnie Ruth's murder of two close friends
The New York Times Newspaper Clipping - "Walking Tours of Dublin"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes biographies of the Incorporated Stage Socety, Fritzi Scheff, Frances Star, Sir William Bruce, Neil Hamilton, Barbara Bel Geddes, James A. Michener, Edith Fellows, and Glenda Farrel.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous - Blank Card Stock from Cruise Liners & Inaugural Ball Card for McKinley-Hobart Election
Miscellaneous - Carter Newman Bealer's Passport, small thought journals, and hand-written newspaper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box includes diaries from Virginia Cloud, Mary Cloud, Joseph W. Collins, Mrs. Gassett, and unidentified authors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains diaries written by Mae Douglas Drown and Marian Drown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box includes diaries written by Harry L. Gray, Ella Hayward, L.H. Peebles, Milton Westheimer, and Wilcox.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains 6 scrapbooks: 3 not labeled, 2 labeled 'Heraldry Scrapbook', and 1 labeled 'A Memory Book'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box ontains 2 scrapbooks. One is labeled 'Autograph Book' and the other is labeled 'Hotel cards'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains 7 notebooks. 1 Account book from 1910, 1 catalog of bell collection, 1 notebook titled 'Art Motis', 1 notebook from 1916, 1 notebook labeled 'English Drama', 1 black album labeled 'Photos', and 1 brown album labeled 'Photos'. The brown album has photos of family, friends, and Dash (referenced in Control Folder).

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The boxes relating to playbills are located in the playbills part of the Closed Stacks.
